column1: Princess Leia Organa
Help me Obi-Wan Kenobi, you’re my only hope
Governor Tarkin, I should have expected to find you holding Vader’s leash. I recognized your foul stench when I was brought on board
Aren’t you a little short for a stormtrooper
Will someone get this big walking carpet out of my way
Someone has to save our skins. Into the garbage chute, fly boy
Why, you stuck up, half-witted, scruffy-looking, Nerf-herder
Would it help if I got out and pushed
Stop that. My hands are dirty
I hope you know what you’re doing
You have your moments. Not many of them, but you do have them
We have powerful friends. You’re going to regret this
You’re a jittery little thing, aren’t you
She was very beautiful. Kind, but sad
I know. Somehow, I’ve always known
Oh, it’s not like that at all. He’s my brother
Same jacket
I just never should have sent him away. That’s when I lost him. That’s when I lost you both
No matter how much we fought, I’ve always hated watching you leave.” — Leia to Han as he departs for Starkiller Base
If you see our son, bring him home
May the Force be with you
